title: China's CPI rises 3% in Sept
text:
chinadaily.com.cn | Updated: 2019-10-15 09:33

Consumers buy vegetables at a supermarket in Handan, Hebei province. [Photo by Hao Qunying / For China Daily]

China's consumer price index (CPI), a main gauge of inflation, increased 3 percent year-on-year in September, the National Bureau of Statistics said Tuesday.



China's producer price index, which measures costs for goods at the factory gate, dropped 1.2 percent year-on-year in September, the National Bureau of Statistics said on the same day.

description: China's consumer price index (CPI), a main gauge of inflation, increased 3 percent year-on-year in September, the National Bureau of Statistics said Tuesday.
